title: ACR/EULAR Gout Classification Criteria
desc: The ACR/EULAR Gout Classification Criteria aids in classification of likelihood of gout.

orgreference.text: Neogi T, et al. 2015 Gout Classification Criteria: An American College of Rheumatology/European League Against Rheumatism Collaborative Initiative. Arthritis & Rheumatology. 20015; 67: 2557–2568. doi: 10.1002/art.39254

inputs.subheading_instructions: If yes, 7+ Classification Criteria required for positive diagnosis

inputs.label_en: Presence of Monosodium Urate (MSU) crystals in a symptomatic joint, bursa, or tophus
inputs.name: sufficient

inputs.label_en: Pattern of joint/bursa involvement during episodes
inputs.name: bursa

options.label: Joint/bursa other than ankle, midfoot or 1st MTP (or involvement in a polyarthritis)
Ankle OR midfoot (as part of monoarticular/oligoarticular episode without 1st MTP)
1st MTP (as part of monoarticular or oligoarticular episode)

inputs.name: charac
inputs.tips_en: Erythema overlying joint (reported or observed); can't bear touch or pressure to joint; great difficulty with walking or inability to use joint.

inputs.label_en: How many episodes with the following time-course?
inputs.name: time
inputs.tips_en: ≥2 time course symptoms, regardless of anti-inflammatory use: (1)Time to maximal pain < 24 hours; (2)Resolution of symptoms in ≤14 days; (3)Complete resolution (to baseline level) between symptomatic episodes.

inputs.name: tophus
inputs.tips_en: Draining or chalk-like subcutaneous nodule, located in typical locations: joints, ears, olecranon bursae, finger pads, tendons (e.g., Achilles).

inputs.name: urate
inputs.tips_en: (Measured by uricase method.) Ideally scored when patient not taking urate-lowering treatment and patient was >4 weeks from an episode. If practical, retest under those conditions. Highest value irrespective of timing should be used.

inputs.label_en: Synovial fluid analysis of a symptomatic (ever) joint or bursa
inputs.name: synovial
inputs.tips_en: Should be assessed by a trained observer.

inputs.label_en: Imaging evidence of urate deposition in symptomatic joint/bursa
inputs.name: decomp
inputs.tips_en: Ultrasound: double-contour sign OR DECT: Demonstrates urate deposition.

inputs.label_en: Imaging evidence of gout-related joint damage
inputs.name: imaging
inputs.tips_en: X-Ray of hands or feet with ≥1 erosion.
